data: 1 00:00:32,500 --> 00:00:35,200 First there was darkness. 2 00:00:35,300 --> 00:00:38,700 Then came the strangers. 3 00:00:38,800 --> 00:00:42,200 They were a race as old as time itself. 4 00:00:42,300 --> 00:00:44,800 They had mastered the ultimate technology... 5 00:00:44,900 --> 00:00:47,700 the ability to alter physical reality 6 00:00:47,800 --> 00:00:49,800 by will alone. 7 00:00:49,900 --> 00:00:53,700 They called this ability "tuning." 8 00:00:53,800 --> 00:00:55,600 But they were dying. 9 00:00:55,700 --> 00:00:58,300 Their civilization was in decline, 10 00:00:58,400 --> 00:01:01,200 and so they abandoned their world 11 00:01:01,300 --> 00:01:04,800 seeking a cure for their own mortality. 12 00:01:04,900 --> 00:01:08,400 Their endless journey brought them to a small blue world 13 00:01:08,500 --> 00:01:11,500 in the farthest corner of the galaxy... 14 00:01:11,600 --> 00:01:13,800 our world. 15 00:01:13,900 --> 00:01:16,300 Here they thought they had finally found 16 00:01:16,400 --> 00:01:18,300 what they had been searching for. 17 00:01:28,200 --> 00:01:31,700 My name is Dr Daniel Poe Schreber. 18 00:01:31,800 --> 00:01:33,500 I am just a man. 19 00:01:33,600 --> 00:01:36,500 I help the strangers conduct their experiments. 20 00:01:37,600 --> 00:01:41,200 I have betrayed my own kind. 21 00:04:58,500 --> 00:05:01,300 You are confused, aren't you ? Frightened. 22 00:05:01,400 --> 00:05:03,100 That's all right. I can help you. 23 00:05:03,200 --> 00:05:04,200 Who is this ? 24 00:05:04,300 --> 00:05:06,000 I am a doctor. You must listen to me. 25 00:05:06,100 --> 00:05:08,800 You have lost your memory. There was an experiment. 26 00:05:08,900 --> 00:05:10,500 Something went wrong. Your memory was erased. 27 00:05:10,600 --> 00:05:11,800 Do you understand me ? 28 00:05:11,900 --> 00:05:14,300 No, I don't. What the hell is going on here ? 29 00:05:14,400 --> 00:05:16,200 There are people coming for you even as we speak. 30 00:05:16,300 --> 00:05:18,500 You must not let them find you. 31 00:05:18,600 --> 00:05:19,700 You must leave now. 32 00:05:19,800 --> 00:05:22,400 Hello ? Are you there ? 33 00:06:01,900 --> 00:06:04,700 Hey, Mr Murdoch. The automat called. 34 00:06:04,800 --> 00:06:07,300 Said you left your wallet there. 35 00:06:07,400 --> 00:06:10,400 I suggest you retrieve it since you only paid for 3 weeks, 36 00:06:10,500 --> 00:06:12,500 and they was up 37 00:06:14,000 --> 00:06:16,000 I've been here 3 weeks ? 38 00:06:16,100 --> 00:06:18,700 It's right there in black and white, Mr Murdoch. 39 00:06:18,800 --> 00:06:20,600 Day and date. 40 00:06:20,700 --> 00:06:23,600 We make our books like our beds, all neat and tidy. 41 00:06:23,700 --> 00:06:26,000 I'll take care of it when I get back. 42 00:06:26,100 --> 00:06:28,400 See that you do. Only thing that makes you a guest 43 00:06:28,500 --> 00:06:30,700 in this joint, pal, is cash on the barrelhead. 44 00:06:48,000 --> 00:06:50,400 House rules. 45 00:07:03,000 --> 00:07:06,900 Mr Murdoch, yes, where is he ? 46 00:07:07,000 --> 00:07:10,500 He just left not 5 minutes ago. 47 00:07:11,700 --> 00:07:13,700 Sleep now. 48 00:07:15,800 --> 00:07:19,900 When the rumba rhythms start to play 49 00:07:20,000 --> 00:07:21,700 Dance with me 50 00:07:21,800 --> 00:07:24,500 Make me sway 51 00:07:24,600 --> 00:07:28,400 Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore 52 00:07:28,500 --> 00:07:30,700 Hold me close 53 00:07:30,800 --> 00:07:33,700 Sway me more 54 00:07:33,800 --> 00:07:37,600 Like a flower bending in the breeze 55 00:07:37,700 --> 00:07:40,100 Bend with me 56 00:07:40,200 --> 00:07:42,600 Sway with ease 57 00:07:42,700 --> 00:07:46,400 When we dance, you have a way with me 58 00:07:46,500 --> 00:07:48,900 Stay with me 59 00:07:49,000 --> 00:07:51,600 Sway with me 60 00:07:51,700 --> 00:07:53,700 Hey, sweetie ! 61 00:07:53,800 --> 00:07:56,000 He said he was your husband's doctor. 62 00:07:56,100 --> 00:07:58,300 He wanted to speak with you. 63 00:08:16,600 --> 00:08:17,700 Excuse me. 64 00:08:19,900 --> 00:08:21,000 Dr... 65 00:08:21,100 --> 00:08:24,000 Schreber. Please, won't you come in ? 66 00:08:24,100 --> 00:08:26,000 You must be Emma Murdoch. 67 00:08:26,100 --> 00:08:29,600 Thank you for coming to see me on such short notice. 68 00:08:29,700 --> 00:08:31,500 What is this ? 69 00:08:31,600 --> 00:08:33,100 A rather crude experiment 70 00:08:33,200 --> 00:08:34,900 designed to further my studies. 71 00:08:35,000 --> 00:08:36,300 I don't understand. 72 00:08:36,400 --> 00:08:38,300 You say you're my husband's doctor, 73 00:08:38,400 --> 00:08:41,100 but he never mentioned you to me. 74 00:08:41,200 --> 00:08:42,500 The truth is, Mrs Murdoch, 75 00:08:42,600 --> 00:08:44,800 John has been coming to see me for quite some time. 76 00:08:44,900 --> 00:08:48,500 He had been grappling with feelings of betrayal 77 00:08:48,600 --> 00:08:51,400 stemming from your marital difficulties. 78 00:08:51,500 --> 00:08:52,800 John told you what happened ? 79 00:08:52,900 --> 00:08:54,500 Yes. 80 00:08:54,600 --> 00:08:56,900 When was the last time that you saw him ? 81 00:08:57,000 --> 00:08:58,300 3 weeks ago. 82 00:08:58,400 --> 00:09:01,900 He packed a suitcase. He was very angry at me. 83 00:09:02,000 --> 00:09:04,800 I understand how difficult this must be for you. 84 00:09:04,900 --> 00:09:07,300 But for John's sake, I would like you 85 00:09:07,400 --> 00:09:08,700 to think of me as your friend, Emma. 86 00:09:08,800 --> 00:09:12,500 It appears John has suffered a psychotic break. 87 00:09:12,600 --> 00:09:14,200 Complete memory loss. 88 00:09:14,300 --> 00:09:15,600 You can't be serious. 89 00:09:15,700 --> 00:09:18,500 Oh, but I am. He may be delusional. 90 00:09:18,600 --> 00:09:21,100 Even violent. 91 00:09:21,200 --> 00:09:24,300 If he were to contact you, you must call me immediately. 92 00:09:24,400 --> 00:09:27,300 Wherever your husband is, he is searching... 93 00:09:28,800 --> 00:09:30,200 for himself. 94 00:09:39,700 --> 00:09:41,800 Good evening, Mr Murdoch. 95 00:09:41,900 --> 00:09:44,400 It is Mr Murdoch, isn't it ? 96 00:09:44,500 --> 00:09:48,200 Mr... was it "J"-something... Murdoch ? 97 00:09:51,100 --> 00:09:52,200 J. Murdoch. 98 00:09:52,300 --> 00:09:55,700 What's your name ? Justin ? Jerry ? 99 00:09:55,800 --> 00:09:59,100 No. 100 00:09:59,200 --> 00:10:01,200 My name's Jason Murdoch. John Murdoch. 101 00:10:01,300 --> 00:10:02,500 Jake Murdoch. How's it going ? 102 00:10:02,600 --> 00:10:05,200 Hi. Jack Murdoch. 103 00:10:09,600 --> 00:10:11,500 Gotta get a grip on myself. 104 00:10:34,600 --> 00:10:37,600 I told the guy cash on the barrelhead. 105 00:10:37,700 --> 00:10:40,900 I said, "Listen, 106 00:10:42,300 --> 00:10:44,800 Upstairs, sir, room 614. 107 00:10:44,900 --> 00:10:47,500 Another call girl. 108 00:10:47,600 --> 00:10:50,200 "J. Murdoch." 109 00:10:51,400 --> 00:10:52,900 Evening, Husselbeck. 110 00:10:53,000 --> 00:10:54,100 Inspector Bumstead. 111 00:10:54,200 --> 00:10:56,700 Your lace is untied. 112 00:10:56,800 --> 00:10:58,300 Sir. 113 00:11:06,300 --> 00:11:07,800 Am I glad you're here, sir. 114 00:11:07,900 --> 00:11:10,500 They say Detective Walenski's got the heebie-jeebies. 115 00:11:10,600 --> 00:11:12,600 Just take what they give me, Husselbeck. 116 00:11:35,000 --> 00:11:36,900 Come on. I ain't got any ltalian sausages. 117 00:11:37,000 --> 00:11:37,900 I'm running out of plates. 118 00:11:41,800 --> 00:11:43,500 Thanks a lot. 119 00:11:43,600 --> 00:11:44,900 Excuse me. 120 00:11:47,000 --> 00:11:47,900 Hello. 121 00:11:48,000 --> 00:11:49,400 Oh, it's you. 122 00:11:49,500 --> 00:11:51,000 You left your wallet here, buddy. 123 00:11:51,100 --> 00:11:52,000 Oh, when did I do that ? 124 00:11:52,100 --> 00:11:53,100 When you was last here. 125 00:11:53,200 --> 00:11:54,200 When was that ? 126 00:11:54,300 --> 00:11:56,200 When you left your wallet. 127 00:11:56,300 --> 00:11:57,900 You expect me to remember ? 128 00:12:00,600 --> 00:12:02,200 Hello. 129 00:12:02,300 --> 00:12:03,300 Excuse me. 130 00:12:03,400 --> 00:12:05,300 No, no, seriously. 131 00:12:09,200 --> 00:12:10,600 Alleged ? 132 00:12:21,500 --> 00:12:24,100 - Where you headed, chief ? - Home. 133 00:12:24,200 --> 00:12:25,300 And where's home ? 134 00:12:25,400 --> 00:12:28,100 Haven't you mugs got anything better to do ? 135 00:12:28,200 --> 00:12:30,200 Well, I'm just trying to do my job, May. 136 00:12:30,300 --> 00:12:32,300 There's a killer out there, in case you hadn't noticed. 137 00:12:32,400 --> 00:12:33,700 Maybe you should be out looking for him 138 00:12:33,800 --> 00:12:34,800 instead of cooling your heels, huh ? 139 00:12:37,200 --> 00:12:39,600 Aw, go on, get out of here. 140 00:12:47,800 --> 00:12:48,700 Come on. 141 00:12:51,300 --> 00:12:53,400 What's that make so far, Husselbeck ? 142 00:12:53,500 --> 00:12:54,600 6 hookers in all ? 143 00:12:54,700 --> 00:12:56,100 I believe so, sir. 144 00:12:56,200 --> 00:12:57,900 Give the man an "A" for effort. 145 00:13:03,200 --> 00:13:05,200 So, Husselbeck, 146 00:13:05,300 --> 00:13:08,500 what kind of killer do you think stops 147 00:13:08,600 --> 00:13:11,500 to save a dying fish ? 148 00:13:11,600 --> 00:13:12,500 You've got me, sir. 149 00:13:12,600 --> 00:13:14,600 Bumstead, what took you ? 150 00:13:14,700 --> 00:13:16,600 This killer's been running circles around us, 151 00:13:16,700 --> 00:13:17,800 thanks to Walenski. 152 00:13:17,900 --> 00:13:19,500 With all due respect, Chief lnspector, 153 00:13:19,600 --> 00:13:20,900 I've known Eddie a long time. 154 00:13:21,000 --> 00:13:22,500 He's a good cop. 155 00:13:22,600 --> 00:13:23,800 Whatever kind of cop Walenski once was, 156 00:13:23,900 --> 00:13:26,600 he let drift a long time ago. 157 00:13:26,700 --> 00:13:28,300 Let me talk to Bumstead ! 158 00:13:28,400 --> 00:13:31,000 Come on, hold it ! 159 00:13:31,100 --> 00:13:33,300 Frank, Frank ! 160 00:13:33,400 --> 00:13:34,600 Whoa ! 161 00:13:34,700 --> 00:13:36,100 Get his arm ! 162 00:13:36,200 --> 00:13:37,400 On your feet. 163 00:13:37,500 --> 00:13:39,100 There's no way out ! 164 00:13:40,600 --> 00:13:42,000 God, can you see ?! 165 00:13:45,500 --> 00:13:46,800 Let me go, let me go ! 166 00:13:46,900 --> 00:13:48,100 I'm not gonna hurt you. 167 00:13:48,200 --> 00:13:49,800 What was that ? 168 00:13:49,900 --> 00:13:51,400 Walenski. 169 00:13:59,300 --> 00:14:02,300 I'm being punished for my sins, right ? 170 00:14:02,400 --> 00:14:04,700 What did I ever do to inherit this ? 171 00:14:04,800 --> 00:14:05,800 Where do you begin ? 172 00:14:05,900 --> 00:14:07,900 Everything Detective Walenski 173 00:14:08,000 --> 00:14:09,800 committed to paper should be here. 174 00:14:09,900 --> 00:14:13,900 The only thing that should be committed is Walenski. 175 00:14:15,700 --> 00:14:18,500 Nothing like a little healthy paranoia. 176 00:14:20,800 --> 00:14:22,700 Inspector Bumstead. 177 00:14:22,800 --> 00:14:24,500 I came here to file a missing persons report 178 00:14:24,600 --> 00:14:26,200 for my husband. 179 00:14:26,300 --> 00:14:28,900 Take it to the front desk. 180 00:14:29,000 --> 00:14:30,600 They told me to come see you. 181 00:14:32,300 --> 00:14:34,500 His name's John Murdoch. 182 00:14:36,600 --> 00:14:40,800 Do these names mean anything to you ? 183 00:14:40,900 --> 00:14:42,100 No. Who are these women ? 184 00:14:42,200 --> 00:14:44,500 Why are you looking for my husband ? 185 00:14:44,600 --> 00:14:47,800 Are you going to accuse him of something ? 186 00:14:47,900 --> 00:14:49,100 Maybe murder. 187 00:14:49,200 --> 00:14:50,200 Whose murder ? 188 00:14:51,700 --> 00:14:52,700 Which one ? 189 00:14:52,800 --> 00:14:55,200 All of them. 190 00:14:55,300 --> 00:14:56,600 Mrs Murdoch, 191 00:14:56,700 --> 00:14:59,300 I'm sorry. I didn't mean to alarm you. 192 00:14:59,400 --> 00:15:00,400 I'm sorry that I came. 193 00:15:00,500 --> 00:15:02,300 Just both made a mistake. 194 00:15:02,400 --> 00:15:05,400 Please, if you'll just give me half a second. 195 00:15:14,600 --> 00:15:16,800 Have we met before ? 196 00:15:16,900 --> 00:15:18,700 If we did, 197 00:15:18,800 --> 00:15:20,200 I hope you're still breathing. 198 00:15:20,300 --> 00:15:21,700 What's your name, honey ? 199 00:15:23,500 --> 00:15:24,600 John. 200 00:15:24,700 --> 00:15:27,100 Well, that's an appropriate name. 201 00:15:27,400 --> 00:15:28,900 Yeah. 202 00:15:33,400 --> 00:15:36,100 I was just thinking. 203 00:15:39,600 --> 00:15:41,600 What you do... 204 00:15:41,700 --> 00:15:45,800 seems kind of dangerous... 205 00:15:45,900 --> 00:15:47,800 right now. 206 00:15:47,900 --> 00:15:49,500 How do you know I'm not the killer ? 207 00:15:49,600 --> 00:15:52,600 You don't seem like the killer type. Why ? 208 00:15:52,700 --> 00:15:55,300 You feeling any urges I should know about ? 209 00:16:07,200 --> 00:16:08,900 Aw, shoot. 210 00:16:53,700 --> 00:16:57,700 So it seems you've discovered your unpleasant nature. 211 00:16:57,800 --> 00:16:58,800 Who are you ? 212 00:16:58,900 --> 00:17:02,400 We might ask the same question, yes ? 213 00:17:02,500 --> 00:17:04,900 Sleep now. 214 00:17:28,500 --> 00:17:30,300 He can tune. 215 00:18:20,300 --> 00:18:22,000 What is to be done ? 216 00:18:22,100 --> 00:18:23,900 This man is dangerous. 217 00:18:24,000 --> 00:18:26,100 It is said he is able to tune. 218 00:18:26,200 --> 00:18:27,600 Impossible. 219 00:18:27,700 --> 00:18:30,300 We have seen it with our own eyes. 220 00:18:30,400 --> 00:18:32,600 On occasion, the imprinting does not take. 221 00:18:32,700 --> 00:18:34,500 They behave erratically when they awaken. 222 00:18:34,600 --> 00:18:38,200 We find them wandering like lost children. 223 00:18:38,300 --> 00:18:41,300 But this one was different, yes ? 224 00:18:41,400 --> 00:18:42,900 What has the doctor to say about this ? 225 00:18:43,000 --> 00:18:44,800 He has failed to report in. 226 00:18:44,900 --> 00:18:46,100 And Mr Quick ? 227 00:18:46,200 --> 00:18:47,800 No more Mr Quick. 228 00:18:47,900 --> 00:18:51,700 Mr Quick, dead, yes. 229 00:18:53,900 --> 00:18:56,100 Poor, poor Mr Quick. 230 00:18:56,200 --> 00:18:59,000 Mr Book... does he know ? 231 00:18:59,100 --> 00:19:02,000 Should we not know, Mr Hand ? 232 00:19:02,100 --> 00:19:04,300 We had hoped to learn more 233 00:19:04,400 --> 00:19:05,700 before sharing with you. 234 00:19:05,800 --> 00:19:08,500 We can know nothing until we possess him. 235 00:19:08,600 --> 00:19:11,300 We must have this man. 236 00:19:15,600 --> 00:19:17,500 My brand, I hope. 237 00:19:28,700 --> 00:19:31,400 I've been so worried about you. 238 00:19:34,800 --> 00:19:36,700 Are you punishing me ? 239 00:19:36,800 --> 00:19:38,700 You know, if disappearing is your way of punishing me, 240 00:19:38,800 --> 00:19:39,900 I don't appreciate it. 241 00:19:40,000 --> 00:19:42,300 I don't know what you're talking about. 242 00:19:44,600 --> 00:19:47,300 I found these keys in my pocket, 243 00:19:47,400 --> 00:19:50,100 so I assume I live here. 244 00:19:50,200 --> 00:19:51,800 You supposed to be my wife ? 245 00:19:51,900 --> 00:19:53,700 Supposed to be ? 246 00:19:55,800 --> 00:19:58,000 You really... 247 00:19:58,100 --> 00:20:00,100 don't know who I am, do you ? 248 00:20:00,200 --> 00:20:01,500 Your doctor called me. 249 00:20:01,600 --> 00:20:03,100 He was worried this might happen. 250 00:20:03,200 --> 00:20:04,100 My doctor ? 251 00:20:04,200 --> 00:20:07,600 Yeah. He... 252 00:20:07,700 --> 00:20:09,500 he gave me his card. 253 00:20:09,600 --> 00:20:12,100 He's desperate to find you. 254 00:20:12,200 --> 00:20:14,400 Schreber. 255 00:20:18,700 --> 00:20:20,100 I feel like I'm living out someone else's nightmare. 256 00:20:20,200 --> 00:20:21,700 What happened to me ? 257 00:20:21,800 --> 00:20:23,300 Why was I seeing a doctor ? 258 00:20:23,400 --> 00:20:26,100 I had an affair. 259 00:20:27,200 --> 00:20:29,700 You were angry at me. 260 00:20:31,300 --> 00:20:32,800 Closing time. 261 00:20:32,900 --> 00:20:35,600 The pool is now closed. 262 00:20:41,900 --> 00:20:42,800 Dr Schreber. 263 00:20:42,900 --> 00:20:45,900 How most unfortunate it is 264 00:20:46,000 --> 00:20:48,800 that we were forced to seek you out here. 265 00:20:48,900 --> 00:20:54,700 You know how uncomfortable we find all this moisture. 266 00:20:54,800 --> 00:20:55,700 I'm sorry. I... 267 00:20:55,800 --> 00:20:57,700 Failed to report in, yes ? 268 00:20:57,800 --> 00:20:58,700 I was frightened. 269 00:20:58,800 --> 00:21:00,300 I have a weak heart, you know. 270 00:21:00,400 --> 00:21:04,400 Your weakness is not, we think, an affair of the heart. 271 00:21:04,500 --> 00:21:06,600 We found this in his hotel room. 272 00:21:06,700 --> 00:21:10,400 Must we reproduce Mr Murdoch's memories again ? 273 00:21:10,500 --> 00:21:11,700 I tried to imprint him, but he woke up. 274 00:21:11,800 --> 00:21:13,300 He knocked the syringe right out of my hand. 275 00:21:13,400 --> 00:21:14,500 I tried to stop him. 276 00:21:14,600 --> 00:21:15,600 He has no memories, then ? 277 00:21:15,700 --> 00:21:16,700 Only fragments. 278 00:21:16,800 --> 00:21:18,800 The procedure, it was interrupted. 279 00:21:18,900 --> 00:21:22,500 I guess it's only a matter of rounding him up. 280 00:21:22,600 --> 00:21:24,200 You have had strays before, right ? 281 00:21:24,300 --> 00:21:26,100 This is no stray, Doctor. 282 00:21:26,200 --> 00:21:27,600 This one can tune. 283 00:21:27,700 --> 00:21:28,900 But that's impossible. 284 00:21:29,000 --> 00:21:30,500 I thought only you had that ability. 285 00:21:30,600 --> 00:21:32,900 You will process another template 286 00:21:33,000 --> 00:21:34,800 of the subject's memories, yes ? 287 00:21:34,900 --> 00:21:37,300 Of course. I'll imprint him again. 288 00:21:37,400 --> 00:21:41,000 No. We require them for a quite different purpose. 289 00:21:41,100 --> 00:21:43,700 It's almost midnight, Dr Schreber. 290 00:21:43,800 --> 00:21:46,200 We'll talk again after tonight's tuning, 291 00:21:46,300 --> 00:21:48,300 but no more delays, yes ? 292 00:21:48,400 --> 00:21:53,100 No more inconsistencies in your behaviour. 293 00:21:54,500 --> 00:21:55,900 The police are looking for you. 294 00:21:56,000 --> 00:21:57,900 I know. I saw the papers. 295 00:21:58,000 --> 00:22:02,700 "Killer Stalks City's Streetwalkers." 296 00:22:04,500 --> 00:22:07,300 I was with one of those women 297 00:22:07,400 --> 00:22:08,600 before I came here tonight. 298 00:22:08,700 --> 00:22:11,900 I don't understand. 299 00:22:12,000 --> 00:22:13,200 I met her outside an automat. 300 00:22:13,300 --> 00:22:16,100 I guess I wanted to test myself. 301 00:22:16,200 --> 00:22:18,900 I wanted to know if I had it in me 302 00:22:19,000 --> 00:22:19,900 to do those things. 303 00:22:20,000 --> 00:22:21,600 Maybe I have lost my mind, 304 00:22:21,700 --> 00:22:24,100 but whoever I am, I'm still me, 305 00:22:24,200 --> 00:22:25,500 and I'm not a killer. 306 00:22:31,000 --> 00:22:32,500 I believe you. 307 00:22:34,300 --> 00:22:36,300 You do ? 308 00:22:40,500 --> 00:22:41,800 The car outside, 309 00:22:41,900 --> 00:22:43,100 the one you arrived in. 310 00:22:43,200 --> 00:22:47,500 It's a cop. He dropped me off here. 311 00:22:47,600 --> 00:22:49,900 I didn't know he was still here. 312 00:22:52,400 --> 00:22:53,600 Hold it right there, mister ! 313 00:22:56,000 --> 00:22:58,100 Wait. You have the wrong man. 314 00:22:58,200 --> 00:22:59,100 Stand aside, will you, please ? 315 00:22:59,200 --> 00:23:00,500 I didn't kill anyone. 316 00:23:00,600 --> 00:23:02,900 Right now all you are is a suspect. 317 00:23:03,000 --> 00:23:04,700 Turn yourself in. 318 00:23:04,800 --> 00:23:06,500 I'll listen to whatever you have to say. 319 00:23:06,600 --> 00:23:08,000 You're not gonna believe what I have to say. 320 00:23:08,100 --> 00:23:10,100 Try me. 321 00:23:10,200 --> 00:23:12,300 There's someone after me. 322 00:23:12,400 --> 00:23:13,800 There's this group of men. 323 00:23:13,900 --> 00:23:15,300 They want me dead. 324 00:23:15,400 --> 00:23:17,100 And I don't even know... 325 00:23:17,200 --> 00:23:18,500 They're not even... 326 00:23:18,600 --> 00:23:20,800 Yeah, who's gonna listen to a madman ? 327 00:23:20,900 --> 00:23:22,000 Stand aside, Mrs Murdoch. 328 00:23:22,100 --> 00:23:23,100 Run ! 329 00:23:27,400 --> 00:23:29,800 No one ever listens to me. 330 00:23:34,600 --> 00:23:36,300 Murdoch, stop ! 331 00:23:41,400 --> 00:23:42,400 Murdoch ! 332 00:24:17,000 --> 00:24:18,200 How much further ? 333 00:24:18,300 --> 00:24:19,700 We're almost there, buddy. 334 00:24:21,700 --> 00:24:24,500 Hey, you happen to know the way to Shell Beach ? 335 00:24:24,600 --> 00:24:25,800 You're kidding. 336 00:24:25,900 --> 00:24:28,300 Me and the missus spent our honeymoon there. 337 00:24:28,400 --> 00:24:30,900 All you gotta do is take Main Street West to... 338 00:24:33,500 --> 00:24:35,200 Or is it the cross... 339 00:24:35,300 --> 00:24:38,900 You know, that's funny. 986 01:09:27,300 --> 01:09:28,600 You are different, John. 987 01:09:28,700 --> 01:09:31,800 You resisted my attempt to imprint you. 988 01:09:35,900 --> 01:09:39,200 Somehow you have developed their ability to tune. 989 01:09:39,300 --> 01:09:40,800 That is how they change things. 990 01:09:40,900 --> 01:09:42,300 That is how they built this city. 991 01:09:42,400 --> 01:09:45,200 They have machines very deep beneath the surface 992 01:09:45,300 --> 01:09:46,300 that allow them 993 01:09:46,400 --> 01:09:49,100 to focus their telepathic energies. 994 01:09:49,200 --> 01:09:50,800 They control everything here, 995 01:09:50,900 --> 01:09:52,100 even the sun. 996 01:09:52,200 --> 01:09:53,700 That's why it's always dark. 997 01:09:53,800 --> 01:09:55,600 They can't stand the light. 998 01:09:55,700 --> 01:09:56,800 So why do they need you ? 999 01:09:56,900 --> 01:09:58,900 When they first brought us here, 1000 01:09:59,000 --> 01:10:00,600 they extracted what was in us. 1001 01:10:00,700 --> 01:10:02,500 So they could store the information, 1002 01:10:02,600 --> 01:10:04,600 remix it like so much paint, 1003 01:10:04,700 --> 01:10:06,200 and give us back new memories 1004 01:10:06,300 --> 01:10:07,200 of their choosing. 1005 01:10:07,300 --> 01:10:09,600 But they still needed an artist 1006 01:10:09,700 --> 01:10:10,600 to help them. 1007 01:10:12,400 --> 01:10:13,900 I understood the intricacies 1008 01:10:14,000 --> 01:10:15,400 of the human mind 1009 01:10:15,500 --> 01:10:17,700 better than they ever could, 1010 01:10:17,800 --> 01:10:18,800 so they allowed me 1011 01:10:18,900 --> 01:10:20,600 to keep my skills as a scientist, 1012 01:10:20,700 --> 01:10:21,900 because they needed them. 1013 01:10:22,000 --> 01:10:24,300 But they made me delete everything else. 1014 01:10:32,400 --> 01:10:35,100 Can you imagine what it is like being forced 1015 01:10:35,200 --> 01:10:36,900 to erase your own past ? 1016 01:10:37,000 --> 01:10:38,800 What about my past ? 1017 01:10:38,900 --> 01:10:40,900 What about my childhood ? 1018 01:10:41,000 --> 01:10:43,600 Shell Beach, Uncle Karl. 1019 01:10:43,700 --> 01:10:45,500 What about this ? 1020 01:10:46,500 --> 01:10:48,200 This was blank when I found it ! 1021 01:10:48,300 --> 01:10:50,100 You still don't understand, John. 1022 01:10:50,200 --> 01:10:51,900 You were never a boy, 1023 01:10:52,000 --> 01:10:53,300 not in this place. 1024 01:10:53,400 --> 01:10:55,100 Your entire history is an illusion, 1025 01:10:55,200 --> 01:10:56,100 a fabrication, 1026 01:10:56,200 --> 01:10:57,800 as it is with all of us. 1027 01:10:57,900 --> 01:10:59,200 You made those drawings happen 1028 01:10:59,300 --> 01:11:00,200 with your gift. 1029 01:11:00,300 --> 01:11:02,700 You say they brought us here. 1030 01:11:02,800 --> 01:11:04,900 From where ? 1031 01:11:08,700 --> 01:11:09,700 I'm sorry. 1032 01:11:09,800 --> 01:11:12,400 I don't remember. 1033 01:11:12,500 --> 01:11:14,100 None of us remember that, 1034 01:11:14,200 --> 01:11:16,300 what we once were, 1035 01:11:16,400 --> 01:11:18,600 what we might have been... 1036 01:11:18,700 --> 01:11:20,100 somewhere else. 1037 01:11:36,800 --> 01:11:38,600 I've taken you this far. 1038 01:11:38,700 --> 01:11:40,700 You don't need me anymore. 1039 01:11:40,800 --> 01:11:42,500 Let's go. 1040 01:12:24,800 --> 01:12:27,500 There is no ocean, John. 1041 01:12:27,600 --> 01:12:31,500 There is nothing beyond the city. 1042 01:12:31,600 --> 01:12:36,400 The only place home exists... 1043 01:12:36,500 --> 01:12:38,400 is in your head. 1044 01:12:46,500 --> 01:12:48,100 No ! No ! 1045 01:12:48,200 --> 01:12:49,900 John, stop ! 1046 01:12:56,200 --> 01:12:57,100 Stop ! 1047 01:13:02,800 --> 01:13:05,400 Please ! No ! 1048 01:13:23,700 --> 01:13:25,700 And now you know the truth. 1049 01:13:44,200 --> 01:13:45,400 No ! 1050 01:14:22,600 --> 01:14:25,300 You'll allow yourself to surrender, Mr Murdoch, 1051 01:14:25,400 --> 01:14:27,700 or it will result in this one's death, yes ? 1052 01:14:27,800 --> 01:14:29,800 What do I care ? She's not my real wife ! 1053 01:14:29,900 --> 01:14:31,100 She's nothing to me ! 1054 01:14:31,200 --> 01:14:35,200 But you do still care, don't you, Mr Murdoch ? 1055 01:14:35,300 --> 01:14:37,700 You see, I have become the monster 1056 01:14:37,800 --> 01:14:39,700 you were intended to be. 1057 01:14:41,600 --> 01:14:45,300 Shall I end her life now as you would have ? 1058 01:14:48,200 --> 01:14:50,100 Don't hurt her, please ! 1059 01:14:50,200 --> 01:14:54,700 Then surrender, Mr Murdoch. 1060 01:14:54,800 --> 01:14:56,400 Sleep. 1061 01:14:58,200 --> 01:15:00,300 Now. 1062 01:15:18,100 --> 01:15:19,100 Sleep. 1063 01:15:27,500 --> 01:15:29,300 Kill him. 1064 01:15:29,400 --> 01:15:30,900 - Kill him ! - Kill him ! 1065 01:15:40,200 --> 01:15:42,400 He is powerful, yes. 1066 01:15:42,500 --> 01:15:46,800 Dangerous. But he can also lead us to what we seek. 1067 01:15:46,900 --> 01:15:50,100 What the doctor calls the soul. 1068 01:15:50,200 --> 01:15:53,500 It is time for our experiment to move into a final phase. 1069 01:15:53,600 --> 01:15:56,300 We no longer need the other subjects. 1070 01:15:56,400 --> 01:15:59,800 The time for study is over. 1071 01:15:59,900 --> 01:16:04,300 It is time to be one with John Murdoch. 1072 01:16:10,400 --> 01:16:12,100 It is time, Doctor. 1073 01:16:12,200 --> 01:16:13,700 Imprint. 1074 01:16:16,300 --> 01:16:18,900 Shut it down ! 1075 01:16:19,000 --> 01:16:22,000 Shut it down forever ! 1076 01:16:34,800 --> 01:16:36,600 What are you doing ? 1077 01:16:37,600 --> 01:16:39,500 They want to imprint you 1078 01:16:39,600 --> 01:16:41,800 with their own collective memories. 1079 01:16:43,300 --> 01:16:45,000 They want to make you one of them 1080 01:16:45,100 --> 01:16:47,200 so they can share your soul. 1081 01:16:47,300 --> 01:16:49,400 But I've got other plans. 1082 01:16:53,100 --> 01:16:55,100 Imprint, Doctor. No more disobedience. 1083 01:16:55,200 --> 01:16:57,000 I'm sorry, John. 1084 01:16:57,100 --> 01:16:59,900 The pain will only last a moment. 1085 01:17:01,900 --> 01:17:02,900 No ! 1086 01:17:10,100 --> 01:17:11,500 Remember... 1087 01:17:13,200 --> 01:17:15,300 You'll rise to greater heights than that, my boy. 1088 01:17:15,400 --> 01:17:17,100 One day when you're older, you'll understand. 1089 01:17:19,000 --> 01:17:21,000 Remember. 1090 01:17:21,100 --> 01:17:23,700 That's it, John. Practice makes perfect. 1091 01:17:23,800 --> 01:17:26,900 Remember what I told you. Never talk to strangers. 1092 01:17:27,000 --> 01:17:28,600 John, remember. 1093 01:17:28,700 --> 01:17:31,500 You're wondering why I keep appearing in your memories. 1094 01:17:31,600 --> 01:17:34,000 It is because I have inserted myself in them. 1095 01:17:34,100 --> 01:17:36,000 Only, these memories have been fabricated 1096 01:17:36,100 --> 01:17:37,800 to teach you about the strangers. 1097 01:17:37,900 --> 01:17:40,700 Give you a lifetime of knowledge in a single syringe. 1098 01:17:43,600 --> 01:17:45,700 You will survive, John. 1099 01:17:45,800 --> 01:17:47,900 You will find strength within yourself, 1100 01:17:48,000 --> 01:17:49,800 and you will prevail. 1101 01:17:49,900 --> 01:17:51,200 Remember. 1102 01:17:52,200 --> 01:17:54,000 - Hi, Uncle Karl. - Johnny ! 1103 01:17:56,800 --> 01:17:58,900 You're getting the hang of it, John. 1104 01:17:59,000 --> 01:18:01,700 Maybe one day I'll be working for you. 1105 01:18:01,800 --> 01:18:03,300 This is the machine the strangers use 1106 01:18:03,400 --> 01:18:04,700 to amplify their thoughts. 1107 01:18:04,800 --> 01:18:06,700 The machine that changes their world. 1108 01:18:06,800 --> 01:18:08,100 You must take control of it. 1109 01:18:08,200 --> 01:18:09,700 You must make the machine yours. 1110 01:18:09,800 --> 01:18:11,400 I know you can beat them, John. 1111 01:18:11,500 --> 01:18:13,500 But you must concentrate. 1112 01:18:16,400 --> 01:18:17,400 Something's wrong. 1113 01:18:25,700 --> 01:18:28,200 There is no time for romance, John. 1114 01:18:28,300 --> 01:18:29,600 The world can be what you make it. 1115 01:18:30,700 --> 01:18:32,500 What have you done ? 1116 01:18:32,600 --> 01:18:35,000 You have the power to make anything happen, 1117 01:18:35,100 --> 01:18:37,400 but you must act now ! 1118 01:23:09,000 --> 01:23:11,100 I knew you could do it, John. 1119 01:23:11,200 --> 01:23:13,000 You have their power now. 1120 01:23:13,100 --> 01:23:14,700 You control their machines. 1121 01:23:14,800 --> 01:23:16,300 Where's Emma ? 1122 01:23:16,400 --> 01:23:19,500 She is not Emma anymore, John. 1123 01:23:19,600 --> 01:23:21,100 She has been reimprinted. 1124 01:23:21,200 --> 01:23:22,400 So give her back her memories. 1125 01:23:22,500 --> 01:23:25,300 I can't. The facility where the strangers 1126 01:23:25,400 --> 01:23:27,800 stored the memories has been destroyed. 1127 01:23:27,900 --> 01:23:29,000 I'm sorry. 1128 01:23:29,100 --> 01:23:32,900 What are you going to do now, John ? 1129 01:23:35,000 --> 01:23:37,400 I'm gonna fix things. 1130 01:23:37,500 --> 01:23:41,700 You told me I had the power, didn't you ? 1131 01:23:41,800 --> 01:23:45,600 I can make these machines do anything I want. 1132 01:23:45,700 --> 01:23:48,900 Make this world anything I want it to be. 1133 01:23:49,000 --> 01:23:53,100 Just so long as l concentrate hard enough. 1134 01:25:12,900 --> 01:25:14,600 Where are you going ? 1135 01:25:17,400 --> 01:25:19,300 Shell Beach. 1136 01:25:58,500 --> 01:25:59,700 - What's the fare ? - Quarter. 1137 01:26:05,700 --> 01:26:06,600 Oh, please. 1138 01:26:06,700 --> 01:26:08,300 Oh, no. 1139 01:26:08,400 --> 01:26:10,400 Thank you. 1140 01:26:54,400 --> 01:26:56,500 Been waiting for you, yes ? 1141 01:26:56,600 --> 01:26:58,200 What are you doing ? 1142 01:26:58,300 --> 01:27:00,900 I'm just making a few little changes around here is all. 1143 01:27:01,000 --> 01:27:03,000 Are we sure that's what we want ? 1144 01:27:03,100 --> 01:27:05,700 I'm prepared to take my chances. 1145 01:27:05,800 --> 01:27:07,400 I'm dying, John. 1146 01:27:07,500 --> 01:27:10,300 Your imprint is not agreeable with my kind. 1147 01:27:10,400 --> 01:27:14,500 But I wanted to know what it was like... 1148 01:27:14,600 --> 01:27:16,500 how you feel. 1149 01:27:16,600 --> 01:27:19,300 You know how I was supposed to feel. 1150 01:27:19,400 --> 01:27:22,900 That person isn't me. Never was. 1151 01:27:23,000 --> 01:27:26,500 You wanted to know what it was about us that made us human. 1152 01:27:26,600 --> 01:27:32,300 Well, you're not going to find it... in here. 1153 01:27:32,400 --> 01:27:34,800 You went looking in the wrong place. 1154 01:29:09,500 --> 01:29:11,500 It's so beautiful here. 1155 01:29:15,900 --> 01:29:17,900 So bright. 1156 01:29:23,700 --> 01:29:26,300 Do you know if Shell Beach is around here ? 1157 01:29:26,400 --> 01:29:28,800 I think that's it just over there. 1158 01:29:46,100 --> 01:29:48,300 I'm headed that way myself. 1159 01:29:49,800 --> 01:29:52,100 Would you like to join me ? 1160 01:29:54,200 --> 01:29:55,200 Sure. 1161 01:30:00,400 --> 01:30:02,800 I'm Anna, by the way. 1162 01:30:02,900 --> 01:30:03,800 What's your name ? 1163 01:30:03,900 --> 01:30:05,100 John. 1164 01:30:07,000 --> 01:30:08,800 John Murdoch. 1165 01:34:45,100 --> 01:34:49,100 When the rumba rhythms start to play 1166 01:34:49,200 --> 01:34:50,900 Dance with me 1167 01:34:51,000 --> 01:34:54,000 Make me sway 1168 01:34:54,100 --> 01:34:57,900 Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore 1169 01:34:58,000 --> 01:35:00,200 Hold me close 1170 01:35:00,300 --> 01:35:03,200 Sway me more 1171 01:35:03,300 --> 01:35:07,100 Like a flower bending in the breeze 1172 01:35:07,200 --> 01:35:09,300 Bend with me 1173 01:35:09,400 --> 01:35:11,800 Sway with ease 1174 01:35:11,900 --> 01:35:15,600 When we dance, you have a way with me 1175 01:35:15,700 --> 01:35:18,100 Stay with me 1176 01:35:18,200 --> 01:35:20,900 Sway with me 1177 01:35:21,000 --> 01:35:25,400 All the dancers with me on the floor 1178 01:35:25,500 --> 01:35:29,900 But my eyes will see only you 1179 01:35:30,000 --> 01:35:35,300 Only you have that magic technique 1180 01:35:35,400 --> 01:35:39,100 Where we sway, I grow weak 1181 01:35:39,200 --> 01:35:42,900 I can hear the sound of violins 1182 01:35:43,000 --> 01:35:45,400 Long before 1183 01:35:45,500 --> 01:35:48,200 It begins 1184 01:35:48,300 --> 01:35:52,100 Make me thrill as only you know how 1185 01:35:52,200 --> 01:35:54,600 Sway me smooth 1186 01:35:54,700 --> 01:35:57,000 Sway me now 1187 01:35:57,100 --> 01:36:00,300 You gotta sway me now 1188 01:36:00,400 --> 01:36:02,600 Come on, babe 1189 01:36:02,700 --> 01:36:04,400 Come on, babe 1190 01:36:04,500 --> 01:36:06,800 Sway, sway 1191 01:36:06,900 --> 01:36:09,600 Take me 1192 01:36:14,300 --> 01:36:17,300 Sway me
